description:
The Scientific Coat Initiative for Future Innovators nonprofit promotes studentsâ€™ scientific passions for higher education, provides teachers the resources necessary for hands-on scientific instruction, encourages the growth of mentor-mentee relationships, and fosters a visible community supporting young scientistsâ€™ endeavors.


Our Berkeley Chapter (Experimental Innovation) has current mission is focused on hands-on experimental learning using real wet-lab equipment we obtained from BioLink Depot and an experiment the students complete in a 1 hour period: we go in-person to local middle/high schools with pipettes, MCT tubes, vortexes, microscopes, and more to introduce students to aspects of research they may not otherwise get to see.

In the past we have also achieved adjacent goals by partnering with corporate and academic sponsors who endorse the purchase of laboratory coats embroidered with the sponsorsâ€™ logos. We then distribute these coats to qualifying under-resourced schools, along with other materials intended to aid educators in taking on a hands-on approach to scientific instruction.

Our motivation as a non-profit organization stems from our early exposure to science, which ultimately inspired us to pursue scientific educations and careers. Thus, our goal is to empower and inspire future generations of scientists by providing Kâ€“12 students the necessary tools to develop fundamental scientific reasoning, address societal problems, and move onto further scientific instruction.
summary: Project SCIFI promotes studentsâ€™ scientific passions for higher education, provides teachers the resources necessary for hands-on scientific instruction, and fosters a visible community supporting young scientistsâ€™ endeavors.
